p: The mitochondrial membrane potential assay was performed by using tetramethylrhodamine ethyl ester (TMRE) to label active mitochondria. Simply, HeLa cells were seeded in 96-well plates (4 × 10 4) cells per well), after incubation overnight, cells were treated with IC 50 of the four plant extracts obtained from the MTT assay and untreated cells worked as negative control. 24 h later, 50 µM of carbonyl cyanide 4-(trifluoromethoxy) phenylhydrazone (FCCP) was added to one sample replicate as a positive control for 20 min, then cells were treated with 500 nM of TMRE and incubated for 20 min at 37 °C. Cells were washed twice with 0.2% bovine serum albumin (BSA) w/ v in PBS, then fluorescence was detected using a Flurostar Optima microplate reader (λ Ex/λ Em = 549/575 nm). For further evaluation of the disruption of MMP, visualization of the MMP analysis was done under a fluorescence microscope (CKX-53 Olympus). All experiments were performed in independent triplicates.
